title: Britain's Got Talent's Twist And Pulse call on Little Mix for collab
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Twist and Pulse have called on Little Mix to collaborate on an epic performance.

We’ll be needing this as soon as possible please.

The duo, who recently won Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions, directly addressed the X Factor winners during an appearance on This Morning.

‘Girls, you four and us two, that could be epic,’ Ashley Glazebrook (Twist) said.

‘They’re such great dancers and we’ve always wanted to collaborate.’

He added: ‘Jesy [Nelson] did actually reach out to us and say congratulations – it’s a little stepping stone.’

Clearly they’re best pals already.

The girls won The X Factor in 2011 (Picture: Stuart C. Wilson/Getty Images)

Before the pair’s spectacular win, they earned Alesha Dixon’s golden buzzer but admitted it was something they’d never expected.

‘The whole thing was just a complete blur,’ they admitted.

‘The Alesha golden buzzer moment, that was one of the crazy moments.’

‘I just remember talking to Dec and then the gold confetti.’

While the pre-recorded format of the show has caused backlash, the pair joked about the secret-keeping aspect.

‘At first it was quite easy because our friends and family were all there,’ they said.

Howeve, ‘There were 6000 people at Wembley, like, “Guys, please can you keep a secret!”‘

Twist And Pulse competed on BGT in 2009 (Picture: ITV)

‘I am absolutely speechless, I can’t thank you guys enough,’ an emotional Glen Murphy (Pulse) told the crowd at the time of the win. ‘I’m holding back everything right now!’

While Ashley continued to Ant McPartlin: ‘Yeah, literally feel amazing. I’ve said it before, things like this don’t happen to me and my best friend Glen, so we’d just like to say thank you so much!

‘This means the world to us, honestly!’

Ant then handed the pair the coveted Champions trophy, before the judges joined them all on stage.

However, it wasn’t a smooth journey to the trophy, as some viewers of the show ended up being livid at the superfans voting.

Nevertheless, the duo were thrilled with their win, recently announcing their 2020 headline tour.
